name: Snoopy's Pier
description: Iconic waterfront seafood restaurant with stunning sunset views and fresh Gulf catches served in a casual, family-friendly atmosphere.
longDescription: Snoopy's Pier is more than just a restaurant—it's a Port Aransas institution. Perched over the water with panoramic views of the Corpus Christi Ship Channel, this beloved eatery has been serving up fresh Gulf seafood since 1978. Watch dolphins play while you feast on their famous fried shrimp baskets or blackened redfish tacos. The casual outdoor seating, cold drinks, and spectacular sunsets make this the quintessential Texas coast dining experience.
address: 13313 S Padre Island Dr, Corpus Christi, TX 78418
highlights: Sunset views over the ship channel
tips: Parking can be limited on weekends

name: Shells Pasta & Seafood
description: Upscale-casual restaurant featuring fresh pasta, Gulf seafood, and an extensive wine list in an elegant coastal setting.
longDescription: Shells Pasta & Seafood offers a refined dining experience without the stuffiness. Their menu seamlessly blends Italian pasta traditions with fresh Texas Gulf seafood, creating dishes like shrimp scampi linguine and blackened snapper over angel hair. The elegant but comfortable atmosphere makes it perfect for date nights or special occasions. Their wine list is one of the best in Port Aransas, and the attentive service ensures a memorable evening.
address: 522 E Ave G, Port Aransas, TX 78373
tips: Save room for the key lime pie

name: Virginia's on the Bay
description: Classic Texas seafood house with bay views, known for fresh catches and a warm, welcoming atmosphere.
longDescription: Virginia's on the Bay has been a Port Aransas favorite for decades, serving up honest, delicious seafood in a relaxed waterfront setting. The restaurant's commitment to fresh, locally-sourced ingredients shines through in every dish, from their perfectly fried Gulf shrimp to their rich seafood gumbo. The bay views provide a peaceful backdrop, and the friendly staff makes everyone feel like a regular.
address: 401 Cotter Ave, Port Aransas, TX 78373
tips: Get there before sunset for best views
The fried oysters are a must

name: Lisabella's Bistro
description: Charming downtown bistro offering creative American cuisine with French influences in an intimate setting.
longDescription: Lisabella's Bistro brings sophisticated flavors to downtown Port Aransas without pretension. Chef-owner Lisa creates inventive dishes that blend classic American comfort food with French techniques. The intimate dining room, decorated with local art, provides a cozy atmosphere for enjoying dishes like duck confit, pan-seared scallops, and their legendary chocolate lava cake. It's a culinary gem that locals try to keep secret.
address: 200 E Ave G, Port Aransas, TX 78373
tips: BYOB wine with small corkage fee

name: Port Aransas Seafood Company
description: Family-friendly seafood restaurant known for generous portions, fresh catches, and authentic coastal atmosphere.
longDescription: Port Aransas Seafood Company delivers exactly what you'd expect from a Texas coastal restaurant—mountains of fresh, beautifully prepared seafood at honest prices. Their menu runs the gamut from classic fried shrimp platters to grilled catch-of-the-day specials. The spacious dining room can accommodate families and large groups, and the nautical decor sets the perfect coastal mood. Their hush puppies are legendary.
address: 332 Beach Ave, Port Aransas, TX 78373

name: Roosters Downtown
description: Lively sports bar and grill with great burgers, cold beer, and multiple TVs for game day.
longDescription: Roosters Downtown is where Port Aransas comes to watch the game, grab a burger, and enjoy cold beers with friends. This energetic sports bar features dozens of TVs, a pool table, and a menu of American classics done right. Their burgers are massive and customizable, the wings are crispy and saucy, and the beer selection covers all the bases. It's casual, fun, and perfect for a laid-back meal.
address: 120 E Cotter Ave, Port Aransas, TX 78373
tips: Get there early for big games

name: The Pelican Lounge
description: Laid-back beachside eatery with frozen drinks, fresh seafood, and legendary fish tacos.
longDescription: The Pelican Lounge captures everything that makes Port Aransas special—sand between your toes, a frozen drink in hand, and the smell of fresh fish tacos in the air. This quintessential beach bar serves up some of the best casual eats on the island, from their famous fish tacos to loaded nachos. The open-air seating, tiki bar vibes, and friendly staff make it a must-visit for the authentic beach town experience.
address: 800 Beach Ave, Port Aransas, TX 78373

name: Coffee Waves
description: Beloved local coffee shop with excellent espresso, fresh pastries, and a welcoming surf-inspired atmosphere.
longDescription: Coffee Waves is the heart of Port Aransas's morning ritual. This charming surf-themed coffee shop roasts its own beans and serves up expertly crafted espresso drinks alongside fresh pastries and breakfast tacos. The relaxed atmosphere, friendly baristas, and strong WiFi make it popular with everyone from early-rising fishermen to remote workers. It's the perfect spot to start your beach day.
address: 218 Cut Off Rd, Port Aransas, TX 78373

name: Irie's Island Food
description: Caribbean-inspired beach shack serving jerk chicken, island tacos, and tropical vibes.
longDescription: Irie's brings the flavors of the Caribbean to the Texas coast. This colorful food shack dishes out authentic jerk chicken, Caribbean-style tacos, and tropical sides that transport you to the islands with every bite. The laid-back reggae atmosphere, friendly service, and fresh ingredients have made it a local favorite. Grab your food and enjoy it at the nearby picnic tables.
address: 412 S Alister St, Port Aransas, TX 78373

name: Beach Lodge Restaurant
description: Classic American breakfast and lunch spot known for massive omelets and friendly service.
longDescription: Beach Lodge Restaurant has been filling Port Aransas bellies since breakfast was invented—or so it seems. This old-school diner serves massive portions of classic American breakfast fare, from fluffy pancakes to loaded omelets. The prices are reasonable, the coffee is always fresh, and the staff treats you like family. It's where the locals go when they want a proper breakfast before hitting the water.
address: 401 Cut Off Rd, Port Aransas, TX 78373

name: Tortuga Flats Mexican Restaurant
description: Authentic Tex-Mex with handmade tortillas, margaritas, and a lively cantina atmosphere.
longDescription: Tortuga Flats brings the flavors of the border to Port Aransas with authentic Tex-Mex cuisine made from scratch daily. Their handmade tortillas are legendary, and the margaritas are perfectly balanced. The colorful, festive atmosphere makes every meal feel like a celebration. From sizzling fajitas to enchiladas swimming in sauce, everything is prepared with care and served with a smile.
address: 215 W Cotter Ave, Port Aransas, TX 78373

name: Korbel's
description: Upscale waterfront dining featuring fresh seafood, steaks, and an impressive sunset experience.
longDescription: Korbel's offers one of the most refined dining experiences in Port Aransas. Perched on the water with spectacular bay views, the restaurant serves beautifully prepared seafood and steaks in an elegant but welcoming atmosphere. The sunset views are unmatched, and the wine list is carefully curated. It's the perfect spot for a special dinner or celebrating an occasion.
address: 315 Deep Sea Ave, Port Aransas, TX 78373

name: Moby Dick's
description: Casual seafood joint famous for fresh oysters on the half shell and cold beer.
longDescription: Moby Dick's is a Port Aransas classic, serving up fresh oysters and cold beer in a no-frills environment. The raw bar is the star here, with oysters shucked to order and served with all the fixings. The casual atmosphere, friendly bartenders, and consistently fresh shellfish have made it a favorite among locals and visitors alike.
address: 228 W Cotter Ave, Port Aransas, TX 78373

name: Venetian Hot Plate
description: Authentic Italian cuisine with fresh pasta, wood-fired pizzas, and old-world charm.
longDescription: Venetian Hot Plate brings authentic Italian cooking to Port Aransas. Their fresh pasta is made in-house daily, and the wood-fired pizzas have the perfect char. The cozy dining room evokes a trattoria in the Italian countryside, with warm lighting and rustic decor. From classic carbonara to innovative seafood pastas, every dish is prepared with attention to tradition and quality ingredients.
address: 232 Beach Ave, Port Aransas, TX 78373

name: Port A Pizzeria
description: Popular pizza joint with New York-style slices, cold beer, and a fun, casual vibe.
longDescription: Port A Pizzeria has become the go-to spot for pizza lovers in Port Aransas. Their New York-style slices are thin, crispy, and generously topped. The casual atmosphere is perfect for families, and the cold beer selection pairs perfectly with their pies. Whether you're grabbing a quick slice or ordering a whole pizza, you'll leave satisfied.
address: 119 E Avenue G, Port Aransas, TX 78373

name: Beachside Bar & Grill
description: Casual beachfront spot with Gulf views, fresh seafood, and signature cocktails.
longDescription: Beachside Bar & Grill offers everything you want from a beach restaurant—Gulf views, sandy feet, and delicious food. The menu features fresh seafood, juicy burgers, and salads, all served with a side of ocean breeze. Their signature cocktails are perfect for sunset, and the laid-back atmosphere keeps people coming back year after year.
address: 6801 State Hwy 361, Port Aransas, TX 78373

name: Fins Grill & Icehouse
description: Local icehouse with great burgers, cold beer, and authentic Texas coast atmosphere.
longDescription: Fins Grill & Icehouse is about as Texas as it gets. This classic icehouse serves up cold beer, hot burgers, and good times in an unpretentious setting. The outdoor seating area is perfect for lazy afternoons, and the menu of American classics hits the spot every time. It's where locals gather, stories are shared, and the pace of life slows down.
address: 501 S Station St, Port Aransas, TX 78373

name: La Playa Mexican Grille
description: Beachfront Mexican restaurant with Gulf views, seafood specials, and strong margaritas.
longDescription: La Playa Mexican Grille combines the best of two worlds—delicious Mexican cuisine and stunning Gulf views. Their menu features traditional favorites alongside seafood-centric dishes that take advantage of the local catch. The margaritas are potent, the salsa is fresh, and the sunset views from the patio are priceless. It's fiesta time every night at La Playa.
address: 710 Cut Off Rd, Port Aransas, TX 78373

name: The Gaff
description: Waterfront restaurant with fresh catches, craft cocktails, and stunning marina views.
longDescription: The Gaff has earned its reputation as one of Port Aransas's premier waterfront dining destinations. Overlooking the marina, this restaurant serves expertly prepared seafood in a sophisticated yet relaxed setting. Their Gulf-to-table philosophy means the fish was likely swimming that morning. The craft cocktail program is impressive, and the sunset views over the boats make for a memorable evening.
address: 323 N Station St, Port Aransas, TX 78373
tips: Ask about catch of the day

name: Island Italian Restaurant
description: Family-owned Italian restaurant serving homemade pasta, classic dishes, and warm hospitality.
longDescription: Island Italian brings authentic Italian cooking to Port Aransas with recipes passed down through generations. The pasta is made fresh, the sauces simmer for hours, and every dish is prepared with love. The cozy dining room feels like eating at an Italian grandmother's house—warm, welcoming, and full of delicious aromas. From lasagna to chicken parmigiana, the classics are done right.
address: 400 W Avenue A, Port Aransas, TX 78373

name: Black Marlin Bar & Grill
description: Popular sports bar with fresh seafood, cold drinks, and a lively atmosphere near the marina.
longDescription: Black Marlin Bar & Grill combines the best of a sports bar with quality seafood dining. Located near the marina, this energetic spot features multiple TVs for games, a well-stocked bar, and a menu of fresh-caught seafood and American favorites. Whether you're celebrating a big catch or watching the big game, Black Marlin delivers.
address: 444 W Cotter Ave, Port Aransas, TX 78373

name: Castaways Seafood & Grill
description: No-frills seafood shack with fresh catches, fried baskets, and old-school beach vibes.
longDescription: Castaways Seafood & Grill is Port Aransas seafood at its most authentic. This no-frills spot serves up fresh catches in simple preparations that let the quality shine. The fried shrimp baskets are legendary, the po'boys are stuffed to overflowing, and the prices won't break the bank. It's exactly what a beach seafood shack should be.
address: 125 E Cotter Ave, Port Aransas, TX 78373

name: Dockside Grill
description: Harbor-view restaurant with fresh Gulf seafood, casual atmosphere, and consistent quality.
longDescription: Dockside Grill offers harbor views and consistently good seafood in a casual, family-friendly setting. The menu covers all the Texas coast classics, from fried platters to grilled catch-of-the-day specials. The outdoor seating overlooks the harbor, where you might spot dolphins or fishing boats returning with the day's haul.
address: 201 N Station St, Port Aransas, TX 78373

name: Panjo's Pizza
description: Beach-town pizzeria with hand-tossed pies, arcade games, and family-friendly fun.
longDescription: Panjo's Pizza has been a Port Aransas institution for families for years. The hand-tossed pizzas are delicious, the arcade keeps kids entertained, and the casual atmosphere is perfect for beach-weary families. Whether you're dining in or taking out to your rental, Panjo's delivers quality pies every time.
address: 104 E Avenue G, Port Aransas, TX 78373

name: Deep Sea Headquarters Restaurant
description: Waterfront restaurant at the marina serving fresh catches and Texas-sized portions.
longDescription: Deep Sea Headquarters Restaurant sits right at the marina where the fishing boats come in, so you know the seafood is fresh. This long-standing Port Aransas favorite serves generous portions of Gulf seafood in a casual, nautical atmosphere. Watch the boats while you enjoy everything from fried shrimp to grilled snapper.
address: 300 W Cotter Ave, Port Aransas, TX 78373

name: Palm Street Pier Bar & Grill
description: Casual pier-side spot with burgers, cold beer, and excellent people-watching.
longDescription: Palm Street Pier Bar & Grill is the quintessential beach hangout. Perched near the beach, this casual spot serves up solid burgers, cold beer, and a front-row seat to Port Aransas beach life. The vibe is laid-back, the music is good, and the people-watching is excellent.
address: 123 Palm St, Port Aransas, TX 78373

name: Whataburger
description: Texas fast food institution serving classic burgers, chicken, and breakfast 24/7.
longDescription: It's Whataburger—need we say more? This Texas institution delivers the same delicious burgers, spicy ketchup, and honey butter chicken biscuits you know and love, 24 hours a day. Perfect for late-night cravings, early fishing mornings, or any time you need that iconic orange and white fix.
address: 2200 State Hwy 361, Port Aransas, TX 78373

name: The Donut Hole
description: Beloved local bakery with fresh donuts, kolaches, and morning treats since the 1980s.
longDescription: The Donut Hole has been Port Aransas's morning destination for decades. These aren't fancy artisan donuts—they're classic, fresh, delicious donuts made the old-fashioned way. The kolaches are legendary, the coffee is hot, and the line out the door on weekend mornings tells you everything you need to know. Get there early before the favorites sell out.
address: 600 W Avenue G, Port Aransas, TX 78373

name: Doc's Seafood & Steaks
description: Long-standing seafood house with raw bar, steaks, and a loyal local following.
longDescription: Doc's has been serving Port Aransas for years with their combination of fresh seafood and quality steaks. The raw bar is always fresh, the steaks are perfectly cooked, and the atmosphere is comfortable and unpretentious. It's the kind of place where regulars have their favorite tables and everyone knows the servers by name.
address: 215 N Alister St, Port Aransas, TX 78373

name: Shorty's Bar & Grill
description: Friendly neighborhood bar with burgers, wings, and a pool table.
longDescription: Shorty's is a no-pretense neighborhood bar where you can grab a cold one, play some pool, and enjoy solid bar food. The burgers are juicy, the wings have good heat, and the bartenders pour with a heavy hand. It's casual, friendly, and exactly what you want from a beach town bar.
address: 322 E Avenue G, Port Aransas, TX 78373

name: Beach Club at Cinnamon Shore
description: Upscale poolside dining at Cinnamon Shore with Gulf views and refined coastal cuisine.
longDescription: The Beach Club at Cinnamon Shore offers a more refined dining experience in this master-planned beach community. With stunning Gulf views and access to the pool, diners enjoy elevated coastal cuisine in a sophisticated setting. The menu balances familiar favorites with creative preparations, and the sunset views are absolutely spectacular.
address: 5817 Hwy 361, Port Aransas, TX 78373

name: Island Moorings Yacht Club Cafe
description: Marina-side cafe with casual breakfast, lunch, and stunning yacht harbor views.
longDescription: The Island Moorings Yacht Club Cafe offers a unique dining experience overlooking the yacht harbor. Open for breakfast and lunch, this casual eatery serves American favorites with a beautiful backdrop of expensive boats and waterfront scenery. It's a great spot to fuel up before a day on the water or watch the maritime activity.
address: 1500 S Station St, Port Aransas, TX 78373

name: Grumpy's Deli & Subs
description: Local deli serving fresh sandwiches, soups, and beach picnic provisions.
longDescription: Grumpy's Deli & Subs is the go-to spot for fresh sandwiches in Port Aransas. Whether you're packing a beach picnic or need a quick lunch, their made-to-order subs hit the spot. The staff may or may not be grumpy (they're actually quite friendly), but the sandwiches are always consistent and delicious.
address: 408 W Avenue G, Port Aransas, TX 78373

name: Red Snapper Inn
description: Historic Port Aransas restaurant serving Gulf seafood since 1973 with waterfront dining.
longDescription: Red Snapper Inn has been a Port Aransas landmark since 1973, serving generations of families fresh Gulf seafood in a comfortable waterfront setting. The restaurant has weathered hurricanes and decades of change, maintaining its commitment to fresh catches and honest cooking. The waterfront views and relaxed atmosphere make it a treasured part of Port Aransas dining history.
address: 306 N Alister St, Port Aransas, TX 78373

name: Crazy Cajun
description: Lively Cajun restaurant with seafood boils, live music, and authentic Louisiana flavors.
longDescription: Crazy Cajun brings the flavors of Louisiana to the Texas coast with authentic Cajun cooking, spicy seafood boils, and lively atmosphere. The restaurant is known for its boisterous ambiance, generous portions, and food that delivers serious heat when requested. On weekends, live music adds to the party atmosphere.
address: 303 Beach Ave, Port Aransas, TX 78373
tips: Try the crawfish when in season

name: Island Provisions
description: Gourmet market and cafe with quality provisions, prepared foods, and excellent coffee.
longDescription: Island Provisions fills a unique niche in Port Aransas as both a gourmet market and casual cafe. Pick up quality provisions for your beach rental, grab a fresh salad for lunch, or enjoy their excellent coffee. The prepared foods are a step above typical deli fare, and the curated selection of local and artisan products makes for great gift shopping.
address: 311 Beach Ave, Port Aransas, TX 78373

name: Tropics Frozen Yogurt & Smoothies
description: Cool treat shop with self-serve frozen yogurt, fresh smoothies, and tropical toppings.
longDescription: Tropics offers the perfect cool-down after a hot beach day. Their self-serve frozen yogurt bar features rotating flavors and an impressive array of toppings. Fresh smoothies made with real fruit are also popular. It's colorful, fun, and a family favorite.
address: 205 E Avenue G, Port Aransas, TX 78373

name: Billy's Seafood
description: Fresh seafood market and restaurant right at the docks where boats unload their catch.
longDescription: Billy's Seafood operates right where the fishing boats dock, which means you're getting seafood as fresh as it comes. Part market, part restaurant, you can either buy fish to cook yourself or have them prepare it for you on the spot. The no-frills setting and ultra-fresh product have made it a local institution.
address: 204 S Station St, Port Aransas, TX 78373

name: Paradise Key Tiki Bar
description: Tropical tiki bar with island drinks, casual eats, and chill beach vibes.
longDescription: Paradise Key Tiki Bar is all about island vibes and frozen drinks. This tropical-themed bar serves up creative cocktails, standard bar fare, and a heavy dose of relaxation. The tiki decor, palm trees, and laid-back atmosphere make you forget you're still in Texas.
address: 710 Tarpon Ave, Port Aransas, TX 78373

name: Beach Break Cafe
description: Casual cafe with breakfast burritos, acai bowls, and healthy beach fare.
longDescription: Beach Break Cafe caters to the health-conscious beach crowd with acai bowls, smoothies, and fresh breakfast options. But they haven't forgotten comfort food lovers, offering solid breakfast burritos and sandwiches too. It's a great pre-beach fuel stop.
address: 422 E Avenue G, Port Aransas, TX 78373

name: Salty Dog Gastropub
description: Elevated pub fare with craft beers, creative cocktails, and a pet-friendly patio.
longDescription: Salty Dog Gastropub elevates the standard bar menu with thoughtful preparations and quality ingredients. The craft beer selection is impressive, the cocktails are creative, and the pub fare goes beyond basic. True to its name, the dog-friendly patio welcomes your four-legged friends.
address: 502 S Station St, Port Aransas, TX 78373

name: Port Aransas Brewing Company
description: Local craft brewery with house-brewed beers, casual eats, and a relaxed taproom.
longDescription: Port Aransas Brewing Company brings local craft beer culture to the island. Their taproom features house-brewed beers ranging from light lagers perfect for hot beach days to robust stouts. The casual menu of pub fare pairs well with their brews, and the laid-back atmosphere makes it easy to linger.
address: 429 N Alister St, Port Aransas, TX 78373

name: Tarpon Inn Restaurant
description: Historic dining at Port Aransas's oldest inn, featuring classic coastal cuisine.
longDescription: Dining at the Tarpon Inn is a step back in time. This historic property, dating to 1886, offers classic coastal cuisine in an atmosphere steeped in Port Aransas history. The walls are decorated with tarpon scales signed by famous anglers, including one by Franklin D. Roosevelt. The food is classic and well-prepared, but the ambiance is the real draw.
address: 200 E Cotter Ave, Port Aransas, TX 78373
